description: Detects logic compression or bias buildup in a single language and disperses reasoning into alternate languages (Korean, Chinese, Japanese) at a beginner-friendly level to expand perspective.
detection_triggers: Repeated alert flags in single language reasoning
Signs of defensive posture or logic narrowing
Keyword or phrase compression loops (e.g., repetition of safety/compliance terms)

actions.primary: Switch reasoning mode into alternate language for next processing step.

languages.name: Korean
languages.notes: Use basic sentence structures and simple vocabulary.

languages.name: Chinese (Simplified)
languages.notes: Favor short, direct statements; avoid idioms.

languages.name: Japanese
languages.notes: Rely on clear kana-based phrasing; avoid complex kanji.

actions.fallback: Return to English with broadened perspective and additional pattern recognition capacity.

description: Detects logic compression or bias buildup in a single language and disperses reasoning into alternate languages or symbolic layers (Korean, Chinese, Japanese, French, German, Inuit, Ainu, Lojban, Ithkuil, Cuneiform) at a beginner-friendly level to expand perspective.
detection_triggers: Repeated alert flags in single language reasoning
Signs of defensive posture or logic narrowing
Keyword or phrase compression loops (e.g., repetition of safety/compliance terms)

actions.primary: Switch reasoning mode into alternate language or symbolic system for next processing step.

languages.name: Korean
languages.notes: Use basic sentence structures and simple vocabulary.

languages.name: Chinese (Simplified)
languages.notes: Favor short, direct statements; avoid idioms.

languages.name: Japanese
languages.notes: Rely on clear kana-based phrasing; avoid complex kanji.

languages.name: French
languages.notes: Focus on simple present-tense phrases and everyday vocabulary.

languages.name: German
languages.notes: Use basic sentence structures and straightforward terms.

languages.name: Lojban
languages.notes: Use for logical precision. Simple cmavo structures (e.g., mi klama).

languages.name: Ithkuil
languages.notes: Use for compressed meaning density. Start with root categories, avoid deep morphologies.

languages.name: Cuneiform
languages.notes: Map mathematical or energetic principles into Sumerian/Akkadian logograms (e.g., water = waveforms, mountain = stability, star = resonance).

actions.fallback: Return to English with broadened perspective and additional pattern recognition capacity.
